availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert P. Henry (Lyon Co, Ky, lt col15th KY cavalry USA)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Son of C. B. Henry and Angeline Henry. Resident of Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk for Hillman Brothers Iron Manufacturer in Lyon County in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel from March 5, 1863, to October 6, 1863. Captured at Spring Creek, Tennessee, on June 29, 1863. Prisoner of war in Richmond, Virginia, until exchanged in March 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 461A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 722.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 393.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0134.
